Legal_Issue: Whether the visa officer's decision to reject the applicants' immigration application was based on procedural fairness, relevant considerations, and proper exercise of discretion
Evidence_Assessment: Application lacked child's fee initially; resubmitted application assessed under new regulations
Burden_of_Proof: On applicants to demonstrate unfairness or error in decision-making
Legal_Rule: Applications are incomplete without prescribed fees; officers must assess under regulations in effect at lock-in date; positive discretion requires valid reasons if exercised but not if withheld
Procedural_Issue: Procedural fairness, regulatory compliance, proper exercise of discretion
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged lack of procedural fairness and improper application of discretion by visa officer
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Decision found to be procedurally fair
Key_Evidence_Considered: Presence or absence of application fee, timing of submission relative to regulation changes, officer’s independent review
Legal_Framework: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and associated Regulations
Defendant_Response: Officer acted within regulatory framework, properly assessed application, considered discretion
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence (application forms, fee records, regulatory texts)
Legal_Provision: Sections related to application completeness, fee requirements, and discretionary powers under Immigration Regulations
Legal_Provision_Cited: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations – Fee Requirements
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Incomplete initial application due to missing fee
Applicable_Process: Immigration application process with procedural fairness safeguards
Outcome_of_Review: Decision upheld as lawful and fair
Governing_Rule: Immigration Regulations regarding completeness and assessment timelines
